node.text:
Have you explored DYNAMIC EQ yet?⁣
⁣
This feature can be incredibly useful in certain situations, especially on really dynamic material like vocals. ⁣
⁣
Let us know if you have any great uses for dynamic EQ!⁣
⁣

node.text:
This might be a bit controversial, but is BALANCE as an artist overrated?⁣
⁣
We’re not saying you should ignore your mental health, and never rest. Rest is important. But in order to really reach your goals, you do have to make some sacrifices!⁣
⁣
What do you think??⁣
⁣
Follow us for more on these topics @cosmicacademy:⁣⁣⁣
⁣
𝐅𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐨𝐰 👉 @cosmicacademy 👈⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣

node.text:
This topic is BIG… and it’s a question we see all the time…⁣
⁣
How do you FIND YOUR SOUND?⁣
⁣
It all comes down to making more music! And over time, your sound will naturally emerge!⁣
⁣
Follow us for more on these topics @cosmicacademy:⁣⁣⁣

node.text:
This one goes in the Reverb Tip “HALL OF FAME”
⁣
⁣⁣
Watch the video to fully see how to go about “syncing” your pre-delay to the BPM of your track! ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Pre-delay is the amount of time it takes until the initial onset of reverb.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
⁣⁣
What do we use it for?⁣⁣
⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Mainly to create separation between our original sound, and the reverb itself. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
If that reverb begins immediately, it can wash away some of the punch/transients/clarity of our sound. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Because pre-delay introduces a timing difference, it can quickly muddy things up if it’s not rhythmically delaying with the rest of your mix. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
It can create an odd hiccup where things sound out of time. Similar to when you first begin DJ’ing and can’t beat match 😭⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Some reverbs have this “tempo sync” feature already built in. Theres also a formula to do this “delay calculator” trick. Honestly, it’s much quicker to just bookmark this page!⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Type your BPM, and try out different values. See which seems to “gel” the reverb to your mix best!⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Works great on vocals, leads, drums, and more. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Did you learn something new today? Comment and let us know! ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
⁣⁣
🤓 Follow @cosmicacademy 🤓⁣⁣

VOLUME!⁣

node.text:
We see a lot of questions about managers. When do you need one? Should you try to find one now?⁣
⁣
A lot of producers think a manager is going to help make them successful. But remember, the only person that can make you successful is YOU 💪⁣
⁣

node.text:
Double-Tap ❤️ if these help! 🔎 Read More Below⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
I like to look at mixing as this giant machine, with 1,000 moving parts.⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Now when all 1,000 parts are moving together, in-sync, they can produce the best possible version of that product (for us it will be our song).⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
However, if only half of those parts are working...the quality of the product is halved!⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Mixing is very similar. There are so many little things you can learn to make a mix sound better.⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
The more "parts to the machine" that you've acquired, the better your mixes sound!⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
So what does this really come down to? PRACTICE!⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Mixing is mostly problem solving. You hear something that doesn't sound "right" and it's your job to fix it. If you don't mix often, you're not exposing yourself to new problems, or learning how to solve them. Those who are great at mixing often know how to solve these problems more than one way. This is advantageous because they can try a few different techniques and see which sounds best for that specific mix.⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
You can see how experience plays such a large role in the quality of your mixes...youtube tutorials can only help so much! ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Instead of avoiding the mixdown stage, dive in head first and be excited to struggle! Be excited to solve problems. Be excited to learn!⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Each mix you get through, will prepare you and better you for the next.⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Hope these tips are useful and if there's anything else you'd like to add you can drop it in the comments!⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣

node.text:
Your BUILD section determines how BIG your DROP can be...
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
We talk this topic often because it's easily a top 3 "most asked question" we receive.⁣
⁣
⁣
Q: How can I make my drop hit harder?⁣
⁣
⁣
Dynamics are everything. In order to have LOUD you must have quiet. In order to have HEAVY you must have soft. In order to have BRIGHT, you must have dull.⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
These quick, side by side, differences allow us to really hear change. Now what if we can use this to our advantage...⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
Try these automation tricks on your build-up sections to create greater impact on your drop.⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
1️⃣ Automate volume down anywhere from 1-3db on your build section. Right when the drop comes back in, automate back to 0.0. You really have to use your ear. It should still sound natural. If you notice its taking too much volume away from the build, don't automate as much. ⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
2️⃣ Use a low pass filter to remove some of the high end in your build ups. Many times we use white noise sweeps, risers, etc which can create a TON of high end energy. Typically its impossible for your drop to "top" this and be brighter. An easy way to combat this, is to automate a low pass filter down as the track builds (to about 10-12khz, use your ears) and then automate it back to fully open on the drop. This allows your drop to be a little brighter than the build.⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
3️⃣ Apply the same concept with a high pass filter. Automate and remove low end as the track builds. You don't necessarily need to use a filter either, you can use a shelf. You really just want to make sure the drop has a significant burst of low frequency. This will create maximum impact. If your build is sub heavy, your drop isn't going to feel bigger / more important.⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
4️⃣ You can also automate stereo wideners to either open, or close, in the build. ⁣⁣You can create a nice contrast for your stereo mix...be aware: the "amount" will vary by song, go with what sounds best!⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
Plugins to check out (that do some of these): Endless Smile, Easy Wash Out (BassKleph), PML DJ FX Rack (Fade2Gray Knob)⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣
⁣
𝐅𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐨𝐰 👉 @cosmicacademy 👈⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣

node.text:
LIKE if you agree with this?!⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Discipline is tough. But absolutely crucial for long-term success. ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
It might feel like being disciplined is being “hard on yourself” but it’s actually you “loving yourself!” ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Just think about it a different way.⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
It might feel like you’re sacrificing a day of gaming / drinking / smoking…. For a day of hard work. ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
But if that hardwork is in the right place, you’re actually setting yourself up so that the FUTURE VERSION OF YOU can be happy. ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Social media is the BEST example for artists. ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Working on Social Media is probably the thing our students hate the most haha. ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
We don’t exactly love it either! ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
In the “moment”… it feels like tedious nonsense, with no end in sight. ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
I’d personally rather spend the day getting drunk by the pool haha. ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
But long term --- where will that get me? ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Instead, building a fan base – in the long term – will help you out sooooo much more. ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Maybe not today, maybe not tomorrow --- but little by little, you’ll get there, and you’ll be happy you did it. ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
(It’s better releasing a record to 1,000 people than 0 people!)⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Health is the best analogy. Eating greasy cheeseburgers with beers today wont kill you. ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
But overtime, it’s not going to help you in the long run. ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Just like working out today --- one time --- and eating one good meal won’t change anything either. ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
But you’re doing it for the long term. You’re doing it for FUTURE YOU!!! ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Think about it like that. What’s your take?⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Follow us for more on this topic @cosmicacademy ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
𝐅𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐨𝐰 👉 @cosmicacademy 👈⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣

node.text:
From the FRONT to the BACK ⭐ IMPORTANT - Read below⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
When many of us hear "Stereo Spacing" we think of left to right mixing. Stereo wideners, Haas Effect, etc.⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
These tricks work very well. Don't forget that we also have DEPTH to work with!! Front to back...⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
This front to back technique is EXTREMELY beneficial because it allows us to clear even more space for our sounds we want up front in the mix. The two easiest ways to place something further away are:⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
1. Volume⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
2. Roll off HIGH frequency⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Lets talk volume...imagine me speaking to you at a constant volume both 6 inches from your face and 60ft from your face. I'll clearly sound louder when I'm in front of you, compared to far away. This is an easy one...sounds you want up front in your mix have to be louder than the less important sounds! ⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
Next is frequency. Higher frequencies have a shorter wavelength than lower frequencies and cant travel as far. Think of the car passing by outside your home...what do you hear from inside? The BASS! Not the high hats. ⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
By rolling off (shelf or low pass filter) some of the high end on a sound, you can push it further away from the listener. This works well when trying to allow one sound to remain upfront, when other competing sounds are in the way. Think of a vocal on top of a synth or instrument, etc. ⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Utilize these tips to gain control over your mix, and create proper balance from front to back!⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Found this helpful? Tap LIKE and be sure to:⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣

node.text:
Can you improve your organization? ♥️ Check this out⁣
⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Hard work is obviously important...⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
At the same time...you can work really hard and get nothing done!! ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Or you could be a hard worker who wastes a lot of time which in turn limits your output, growth, production, etc!⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Combine hard work with SMART work to maximize efficiency! ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Spend some time each week organizing your DAW, plugins, sample library, reference tracks, etc.⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
This comes in handy when you do sit down to actually work on music. Seconds that you save now, add up to minutes each day...which becomes hours each month...and so on! ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Being organized with your samples + sound library will even help you remain creative without getting bogged down by spending hours “hunting for that specific sound”.⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Hope this reminder helps and spend some time over the next few days cleaning things up!! Your future producer self will thank you!! ⁣⁣⁣ ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
🧠 Follow @COSMICACADEMY 🧠⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣

node.text:
Try these out in your next project!
⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣
It can be very hard to avoid that "robotic / cheesey" sound.  There's almost no way of avoiding this problem considering the amount of MIDI programming we use on synths, drums, etc. ⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Use these six tips to help create a more realistic sound, as well as hopefully open up some new creative avenues for your productions!⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣

node.text:
LIKE if you agree?!⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
We find that a well balanced life is the best kind.⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
If you go too hard on one area, you’ll lack in the others.⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Some people will just chase money, and neglect their health.⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Some will just worry about physical health, and forget about mental health.⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
The truth is: making sure you have hobbies in all area is key!!⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
You probably already have a few of these going…. Which areas are you lacking?⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Follow us for more tips to help you with that 5th one :D⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣

node.text:
SAVE THIS ❤️ and build your producer muscles!⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣
**These should be done in addition to your normal studio sessions where you work on your songs!!⁣⁣
⁣
This is one we've posted in the past...it's a BIG HIT! Be sure to save it if you haven't already.⁣
Utilize these daily, 30-minute side sessions to stay organized, practice, learn, etc. ⁣⁣
⁣
🗓Sunday - Sound Design. Try and keep this one CREATIVE. Create from scratch, not a tutorial. If it comes out cool, save it and use it in your next project!⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣
🗓Monday - Clean up and organize your sh*t!! This is so important towards workflow. Get rid of things you dont use. Label sounds correctly. Do the dirty work now so you can work quicker in your projects.⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣
🗓Tuesday - Tutorial on sound design. Watch a remake video, create as you watch, save the sound as a rack / channel strip.⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣
🗓Wednesday - Sample hunting. Go find great sounds, presets, etc. This will save you the time of having to find them while working on your track.⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣
🗓Thursday - Tutorial on mixing. Learn a new technique, apply what you learn immediately! Limit yourself to one tutorial here. Application is more important than "how many" you watch.⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣
🗓Friday - Arrangement Template. Find a track you like, start from the beginning and create a channel + empty midi clip for every sound you hear. In the end, you'll have the structure of a top track laid out in front of you. Learn from it, use it and replace those clips...its up to you!⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣
🗓Saturday - Learn your tools! RTFM (read the f*cking manual) for your plugins. Try a new one you just downloaded. You should know these things BEFORE working on your song. Don't stop a project to go learn how to use something.⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣
⁣⁣
⁣⁣
⁣⁣
